dcterms:creator: Scott E Reed
Yi Zhang
Yuting Zhang
Honglak Lee
dcterms:description: Sprites is a cartoon character video dataset. Each character’s (dynamic) motion can be categorized into three actions (walking, spellcasting, slashing) and three directions (left, front, right). The (static) content comprises of each character’s skin color, tops color, pants color and hair color. Each color has six variants. Every sequence is composed of 8 frames of RGB images with size 64 × 64.
dcterms:title: Sprites

dcterms:creator: Niki Aifanti
Christos Papachristou
Anastasios Delopoulos
dcterms:description: MUG is a facial expression video dataset. The static factor corresponds to the person’s identity. Each individual performs six expressions (motion): anger, fear, disgust, happiness, sadness and surprise. Each sequence contains 15 frames of RGB images with size 64 × 64 (after resizing).
dcterms:title: MUG

dcterms:creator: Emily Denton
Rob Fergus
dcterms:description: SM-MNIST (Stochastic Moving MNIST) records the random movements of two digits. Each sequence contains 15 gray scale images of size 64 × 64. Individual digits are collected from MNIST.
dcterms:title: SM-MNIST

dcterms:creator: J. Garofolo
Lori Lamel
W. Fisher
Jonathan Fiscus
D. Pallett
N. Dahlgren
V. Zue
dcterms:description: TIMIT is a corpus of read speech for acoustic-phonetic studies and speech recognition. The utterances are produced by American speakers of eight major dialects reading phonetically rich sentences. Following prior works, we extract per-frame spectrogram features from audio, and segments of 200ms duration are chunked from the original utterances and then treated as independent sequences for learning.
dcterms:title: TIMIT
